p:
Study area - Recife, the capital of Pernambuco State, is a coastal city characterised by a warm and humid climate with an annual mean temperature of 25.5ºC with narrow variations, greatly favouring mosquito proliferation throughout the year.
19 Lymphatic filariasis and dengue fever are both endemic in Recife,
18
,
20 while Chikungunya and Zika viruses were introduced in 2014-2015.
12 Sítio dos Pintos, one of the 94 neighbourhoods of Recife city, is a suburban area located in the far west of the municipality (8 º 03’S 34 º52’W) adjoining a remnant of the Atlantic Forest. It has a low population density, 7276 inhabitants in 1.8 km 2 (40,49 people/km²), compared with other neighbourhoods of the city whose average is 142,84 people/km².
21 In 2005, Recife city recorded 2950 confirmed cases of dengue, while in 2013, only 987 cases were registered. Therefore, Sítio dos Pintos was selected considering the following criteria: it is an urban area located in a transition zone, where Ae. albopictus was first recorded in Recife city in 2000;
22 a subsequent study showed the coexistence of Ae. aegypti e Ae. albopictus
18 and, as described, arboviruses have also been historically reported in Sítio dos Pintos. The incidence coefficient of dengue in this neighborhood was 0.2 in both years. (http://portalsaude.saude.gov.br. Retrieved 07-05-2019).
